go  wheat  free.  No pasta, pizza, bread and so on. And no food
after  7  p.m. People achieve marvellous results with it. Depending on
your  initial  weight, you can drop upwards from 20 pounds a month. If
you  don't  eat  wheat then you don't eat all those sticky, fatty goey
cakes,  you  don't eat junk food, and you don't eat biscuits. But your
diet  is  still  balanced.  It  costs  nothing, and you do not have to
calculate  points  or  to  buy special meals or plans.
 Gym Routine for Toning Up & Weight Loss

Working  out at the gym can improve your fitness level, develop muscle
tone and help you lose weight if follow a plan. Outline your course of
action  to  include  the five components of a balanced fitness routine
and your time will be well spent.

The Five Components
The  five  components  to  a  balanced  routine include cardiovascular
endurance,  strength  training,  flexibility,  core-strengthening  and
balance.  You  do  not need to incorporate all five elements into your
training  every  time you workout, but you will want to make sure they
have  been  included  during  the  course  of several days. You should
include  cardiovascular  workouts  three  to  five  times per week and
strength training twice a week, that is a good schedule to start with.

Monday, Wednesday, Friday: Cardio
On  these  three  days,  you will want to use a cardio machine at your
gym.  A good choice for beginner through advanced-level fitness is the
elliptical   machine.   Other   options   are  the  stationary  bikes,
stair-steppers  and  treadmills. Your cardiovascular workout will last
for  20  minutes.  Start  out going at about 50 percent of the maximum
exertion  you  are capable of -- or level five out of 10. Stay at this
moderate  level  for  two  minutes,  then  increase either your speed,
resistance  or  incline to make your exertion more difficult, or level
six  for  one minute. Continue increasing your level of difficulty for
one  minute intervals until you reach 90 percent of your maximum, then
return  back  to  level  six for one minute. When you are on your last
interval  cycle,  or  when you hit 19 minutes, give 100 percent effort
for  one  minute.  Then  take  it  down  to a level four for your last
minute. You will want to stay at this lower exertion level long enough
to  return  to  as  close  to your normal breathing as possible before
ending your cardio workout.
 
Monday, Wednesday, Friday: Resistance
You  want  to make sure to include all of you major muscle groups over
the course of the week if you do not include them all daily. The major
groups   are   back,  chest,  legs,  abdominal,  biceps,  triceps  and
shoulders.  Remember  to work opposing muscle groups such as chest and
back.  If  there  is a chance you might miss a day, try to include all
the  major groups each time you workout. Also, alternate between using
free-weights and machines for even greater variety and faster results.
Do  three sets of weight-bearing exercises per muscle group. The first
set  should  be  heavy, but comfortable. For you that might be a bicep
curl  that weighs 10 lbs.; do 12 repetitions. The second set should be
heavier  than  the  first so try 12 lbs.; do 10 repetitions. The third
set  should  be your heaviest and it should be difficult to finish; do
eight reps.
 
Tuesday and Thursday
Some  trainers  will  tell  you  that interval training burns the most
calories  and  others  will  tell you hard and fast cardio is the best
training to lose weight. Do both and you wont have to worry. Pick your
machine;  you  will  want  to  work  out  at  an exertion level around
75-percent of your maximum ability for a solid 40 to 45 minutes with a
five  minute cool down at about a level five out of 10. These are good
days  to  do  abdominal  exercises  if  you  did not have time on your
interval days. Use a stability ball to do 25 crunches, four times, for
instance. Spend at least 10 minutes after your workout stretching.
 
Saturday and Sunday
Take  Saturday  to  enjoy an activity with your family or to have fun.
Make it something where you will get your heart-rate up, but you might
not  consider  it  a  workout. Consider roller-skating, dog-walking or
bicycling. And on Sunday, let your body rest. Your body needs a day to
recuperate  so  that  you can continue your fast-track towards meeting
your fitness goals.

answers.answer_text: Try taking a melatonin supplement.

First, try vitamin supplements. It may seem unrelated, but it helps. At night be sure to turn off all electronics that receive radio waves! That can interfere with your sleep without you knowing it. Make sure your diet and exercise are at a standard level, if all else fails consult a physician. There are a number of disorders with sleep deprivation as a symptom, but it's most likely not that
Get a really tough workout that will leave you jaded. You will sleep more soundly and longer.

Nice shower before bed helps. We make sure no disturbance from any noise. Good nutrition and vitamins everyday helps too. Be organize in your bedroom. Dont make your bedroom like an office. Your cell phones should be few meters away from your head . Some people sleep with their cellphone next to their face. who knows maybe the cellular radiation has effect on your sleep rhythm.  Dont watch tv too late. Make sure room is dark enough so no disruption in the morning.
Just don't watch tv before you sleep.

Most sleeping problems are probably caused by stress, depression, anxiety and worry. 

Sleeping pills can give you bad side effects such as headaches and drowsiness during the day so you are better off without them. 

To sleep better just relax and switch off, if you can. 

If you are having trouble switching off at bedtime some light exercise (for example, push ups or sit ups) at bedtime often helps you to relax, unwind and switch off and that often improves your sleep. Strenuous exercise at bedtime is likely to ruin your sleep. 

Common OTC sleep aids include Chamomile tea, 5-HTP, Melatonin and Valerian Root. 

Sleep enhancing foods include warm milk, turkey, cherries, oatmeal, bananas, wine and others that you can see in a web search for "sleep enhancing foods". 

You can see further tips in a web search for "how to fall asleep and stay asleep".

Dear Friend, 

All people have ups & downs. You are not alone. When I was younger I also had some tough times. Know you have a friend - me - & a bright future. If things are bad, things can only get better. Right? You are a special person. People love you much more than you think. 

Seek help from people & G-d, solve problems, be patient & you will overcome them & be a better person for it. Your life will improve and pain will subside and you will live a more meaningful existence. "This will also pass." 

I am sorry about your situation. We can overcome any problem. You can too. I believe you can! Certain things can make life easier:

1. Recognize the Good in Life 

Make a list of all the good that you have in life. Know that G-d is providing you with everything, Like: 
Your life, your family, your car, your house, your food, your air, your clothes, your water, your functioning body, your education, your money, your world, your pets, your computer, your electricity, your senses, your brain, your ability to think, etc. 

Don't be lead just by the heart. Use your mind to direct your life & let your heart follow. See: 

Set Yourself Free – Breaking Out of a Negative Mindset & Anxiety 
http://jerusalemlife.com/?p=2284 

2. Recognize the good in You 

Realize your importance. If you saw a person drowning, G-d Forbid, would you probably would try to save them. This shows you are a caring person. Seek help from others instead of hurting yourself. Aren't you just as important than a drowning person? 

Take a paper & write all your good qualities & characteristics. Hang it your wall to appreciate yourself daily. 

If you want a list of good qualities that you can just circle: 
Appreciating Your Own Greatness – Feeling Good About Yourself 
http://jerusalemlife.com/?p=2926 

At the Jerusalem Life site you can order the You are special card to remind you of how special you are. 
http://jerusalemlife.com/?wpsc-product=y... 

3. People Love You. Talk it with Others 

Please don't hurt yourself. Be patient & things will get better. Speak with friends or family, a social worker, a trusted psychologist and/or an orthodox rabbi about your concerns & they will help soothe your concerns. People want to help. Have the courage to reach out. Please reach out for your own good. Make friends with good people. Choose friends & family that bring you up not down. 

4. Solve Your Problems Slowly & Patiently 

Write down : What is the problem? What are the causes? What are possible solutions? Implement these solutions. Be patient & recognize even small improvements. Life doesn't usually change overnight, but things get better & you start seeing light in life little by little. 

5. G-d Loves You - Reach out to G-d & He will help you 

Jews believe & know that G-d is Good. Sometimes problems arise to wake you up to become closer to Hash-m / G-d. You have a Father in Heaven & He wants you to seek Him. When make an effort to solve your problems and try to become closer to Him problems many times are solved. G-d appreciates when you reach out to Him. 

G-d loves the people he created. You are a person that G-d created. Meaning G-d loves you. Developing a relationship with Him opens up a new dimension in your life. He has the power to do everything to make your life better. You Just have to pray to Him. 

G-d created the Universe. He is omniscient & omnipotent. Jews believe that G-d has no physical or spiritual shape or form. Abraham taught anything that has a weakness or limitation cannot be G-d. He taught it is impossible for G-d to be an object, star, animal, plant or person. 

You can always start over. Here is an article on Starting Over – Wiping the Slate Clean in Judaism 
http://jerusalemlife.com/?p=1357 

Pray to the G-d of the Universe - that gave the Jews the Torah - the God of Abraham, Isaac & Jacob. I heard a story of a woman that went to see my friend - a Doctor. She was proud to say she was following the Seven Noahide laws. He asked her why? She said was not answered when she prayed to other "gods". When she prayed to the G-d of the Jews, she was answered. 

6. Seek Answers to Your Questions 

You can also search or contact the Jewish sites about your life questions or for help like: 
http://aish.com 
http://jerusalemlife.com 

7. Do Good, Be Good & Feel Good 

When you do kindness to others you feel better about yourself. 

For Jews I would recommend joining an Orthodox Synagogue to be part of the community. There one can Volunteer for Bikur Holim - Visiting the Sick, or Participate or help Organize Torah Lectures, or Teach others Hebrew or about Judaism. Opportunities abound. Be part of the Community. 

For Gentiles I would suggest learning about the & Noahide laws & joining a Noahide community. 

For Both I would suggest doing something productive daily like working at a Job & focus on helping people. 

Follow the 7 Noahide Commandments for all humanity according to the Torah. They are called such because they were given to Noah - by G-d to assure the peace & proper functioning of the world. Gentiles don't have to convert to Judaism to receive a place in heaven: they just have to follow the 7 Noahide laws. A gentile / non-Jew that follows them because of the Torah is considered a "Righteous Gentile." The Seven Noahide Laws are seven major categories – that with their details consist of 30 laws. 

1) Respecting G-d – Not to blaspheme. 
2) Being Faithful to G-d – Not to Commit Idolatry. 
3) Respecting Human Life – Not to Kill. 
4) Respecting One’s Fellow’s Property – Not to Steal. 
5) Respecting the Integrity of the Family – Not to commit forbidden relations – which includes prohibitions of adultery, incest, bestiality & homosexuality. 
6) Respect of Life – Not to eat a limb taken from a living animal. 
7) Law & Order – Establishing courts of law to enforce these laws. 

The Torah is the law that G-d gave to the Jews in front of millions of witnesses, It was the only time in history that he gave a law to an entire nation. G-d never did & never does change his "mind." 

http://www.aish.com/jl/jnj/nj/ 
http://noahidenations.com 
http://asknoah.org 

Remember also G-d forgives when a person sincerely repents. Even if a person did bad in their life they can Start Over. 

8. Suffering Passes & is for a Purpose 

A Wise Man said to a person who had ups & downs in life "This will also pass." When in pain remember "This will also pass." Print it out in big letters & keep it on a wall to remind you. 

A person gets used to tough times or learns to cope, or learns to appreciate it or it passes altogether. King David used to appreciate difficulty, because he in it he would feel a closeness to G-d. 

Butterflies are beautiful. They enter a cocoon to emerge as a beautiful creature. At times suffering helps a person to introspect about how to improve & they emerge as a beautiful person. 

Suffering helps us gain a clearer perspective. I used to think life's goal was to "Get rich, Be Popular & Make waves." After my pains, I realized G-d wants us to be a Good person. To use our talents to help others. To Bring out our best & curb our desires that bring us sometimes off the road of happiness. 

Try to use the suffering to become closer to G-d & to become a better person. Your suffering is for a purpose. It is not in vain. I found it out from experience. We only see life in a limited perspective - G-d sees it from the beginning of time till the end of time. Your difficulties will make you stronger & allow you to become a greater success - because you went through difficulty & overcame it. 

Because life is difficult it doesn't mean that it is bad. A person suffers to get an education but in the end they reap fruits. Suffering opens new doors that one would have not considered before. I experienced suffering & it allowed me to become closer to G-d & spirituality. 

9 Seek to Satisfy Your Soul - Spiritual Renewal through Torah 

A person is really a soul not a body. Spirituality is feeling a closeness to G-d. The soul at times feels sad sue to a lack of spirituality. It may feel it is not performing it's purpose. You have a purpose in the world & you achieve it by following & learning the commandments of the Torah. 

Some pleasures make the soul happy & pleasures that make the soul sad. Do the pleasures that make the soul happy, like the 7 commandments mentioned above. Help people. Do Kindness. Help your family. Get a Job. Do projects that will help others. You can ask an orthodox Rabbi if you want to know of good projects. 

If You are Jewish Learn Torah & speak with an orthodox Rabbi to learn more & call to Hash-m & he will help you. If you are not, learn the 7 Noahide laws speak with an orthodox Rabbi to guide you & call to Hash-m & he will help. Try to do simple Mitzvot - Like saying the Food blessings, or saying Shema in the Morning and Night. Listen to some Jewish Music. 

When suffering I used to go to the Public library & read Jewish short story books from Orthodox Jewish sources to soothe me. I would also go to Jewish bookstores. Reading the stories helped me to cope & see life in different perspective & change myself for the good. Some good sources to purchase books are Artscroll & Feldheim Publishers. 

If you are Jewish I would suggest you learn the Pirkei Avot / Ethics of the Fathers. If you are not Jewish, I would suggest you read the Path of the Righteous Gentile: 
http://amazon.com/The-Path-Righteous-Gentile-Introduction/dp/087306433X/
Both works teach how to live life with more meaning. 

10. Please make an Effort to Care for Yourself Because G-d Cares about You 

You are one of G-d's creations & He loves his creations. G-d wants you to live and enjoy life. People do care about you. I am one of them. Hope this helps. & I hope everything works out for the best for you. You have a friend. 

All the best. 
Your Friend.

questions.title: Should I kill myself?
questions.body: hey everybody. I'm an YY year old guy from the netherlands and I'm really depressed. I want to kill myself very soon, probably by jumping off a building. My situation is as followed: I have been depressed for about 3 years now but no one ever knew. I have my ways of hiding it I guess. It never even got in the way school-wise (grades and such) until this year. I quit college a few weeks ago because of it. I've always ran away from it using animes, cartoons, games and marijuana (I'm not a pothead though). I comfortably could flee to my own perfect fantasy world. Right now my parents are very disappointed and shocked that I never told them about it, which I did about two weeks ago. The fights with my parents are getting worse, especially with my mom. And they don't know what to do with me anymore. And frankly I don't either. I don't see a future, and I've never seen one. I was just always able to run away from myself and the world. I don't have a job, education, any special skills or talents and no confidence. I don't see much reason to choose to live this life. Should I just accept that this world will not make me happy/that I'm too weak for this world, and kill myself?

Below are five ways to control your anger:

A. Take a deep and continuous breath: Take deep breaths to calm yourself down. Stop thinking about what is making you angry and take a nice deep breath and hold it for a second or two... then breathe out slowly. Do this for 8 to 10 inhalations and exhalations.

B. Do some physical exercises: When you are angry, your body is very tensed and tough. If you stretch your muscles it will relax your body, and release your negative energy. Your brain will get more oxygen and assist you in clearing your thoughts.

C. Be Grateful: Find things to be grateful for. Be grateful that you have woken up today. Thank the Sun for shining, and realize there are people in your life that love you.

D. Meditation: Meditation is easy to learn. About 5 to 7 minutes of practice a day is all you need. You will notice that you get less angry the more you practice meditation.

E. Master Your Thoughts: The bottom line is that you are angry because you cannot CONTROL your THOUGHTS!

The idea of controlling your anger is beautifully expressed by the Bible psalmist David. He said: “Let anger alone and leave rage; do not show yourself heated up only to do evil.” (Psalm 37:8) The way to avoid saying or doing something that you may later regret is to keep from getting “heated up” in the first place. Of course, that is much easier said than done. But it can be done! Let’s consider three ways that you can get your anger under control.

“Let Anger Alone”.
To reduce anger, slow down and relax. Try to avoid saying the first thing that comes to mind. If you feel yourself getting overly excited and feel you are in danger of losing control of your emotions, apply the Bible’s counsel: “The beginning of contention is as one letting out waters; so before the quarrel has burst forth, take your leave.”—Proverbs 17:14.

“Learn to Relax.
A calm heart is the life of the fleshly organism.” (Proverbs 14:30) Applying this basic Bible truth can improve one’s emotional, physical, and spiritual health. Start by learning simple relaxation methods, which help to reduce feelings of anger. The following techniques p. 9have proved to be effective in combating stress-related anger:
 â— Breathing deeply, which is one of the best—and fastest—ways to reduce the intensity of your anger.
 â— While breathing deeply, repeating a word or phrase that is calming to you, such as “relax,” “let it go,” or “take it easy.”
 â— Immersing yourself in something you enjoy—perhaps reading, listening to music, gardening, or some other type of activity you find relaxing.
â— Getting regular exercise and eating a healthful diet.

Adjust Your Expectations. 
You may not be able completely to avoid the people or the things that act as anger triggers, but you can learn to control your reactions to them. This involves changing the way you think.As imperfect humans, we all get angry from time to time. But how we express our anger is a matter of choice. The apostle Paul cautioned fellow Christians: “Be wrathful, and yet do not sin; let the sun not set with you in a provoked state.” (Ephesians 4:26) Yes, by controlling our anger, we can express our feelings in a positive way, a way that works for the benefit of everyone involved.

“HABITS are like a soft bed—easy to get into but hard to get out of.” So goes one saying. And how true this is of masturbation

Because of the changes taking place within his or her body, a youth can become sexually excited even when he or she is not necessarily thinking about sex
. Among boys, for instance, the tensions produced by various worries, fears, or frustrations can affect their sensitive nervous systems and cause sexual arousal.
 A buildup of semen may in turn produce a nocturnal emission (wet dream), usually accompanied by an erotic dream, or cause a boy to awaken sexually excited
. Similarly, some young girls may find themselves stimulated accidentally. And a young woman may have a heightened sexual desire just before or after her menstrual period.

So, often it is what one reads, watches, or listens to for entertainment, talks about, or meditates on, that makes it hard to avoid masturbation. Therefore, being careful about what you take into your mind is essential to break this habit.

For some people masturbation may become a habit to which they turn for solace whenever they are rebuffed or feel apprehensive about something. Others, however, may withdraw in this way only occasionally, when they are under the most acute emotional stress.”

A high proportion of masturbatory experiences are motivated less by erotic needs than by general anxiety, tension, and boredom for which it becomes a sought-for tranquilizer

.” So when one is upset, depressed, lonely, or under much stress this habit becomes a convenient “tranquilizer” to blot out one’s troubles. (Compare Proverbs 31:6,Â 7.) 

Therefore, to avoid masturbation, you must recognize this as an immature way to deal with problems and be willing toÂ 

The urge to resort to masturbation for sheer pleasure when things are not going well in one’s life can easily cause one to become a ‘senseless slave to various desires and pleasures.’ (Titus 3:3)

 Yet, the apostle Paul states: “I will not let myself be brought under authority by anything.” (1Â Corinthians 6:12) He was not going to let his desires become like a harsh master.

 On the contrary, Paul wrote: “I pummel my body [fleshly desires] and lead it as a slave.” (1Â Corinthians 9:27) He got tough with himself! A similar effort will enable anyone to break free from masturbation—regardless of how hard that is to do.

 I hope this helps
.Â

answers.answer_text:
It sounds like you are going through a difficult time.  We are sorry to hear that you are feeling so depressed.  Please keep in mind that suicide is a permanent solution to a temporary problem. 

Dealing with depression can be difficult, but it is not impossible feel better. The good news is that depression can be treated in a healthy way with using your coping skills, medication (if needed) and/or counseling. What we mean by coping skill's are to do things that make you feel good about yourself and that you enjoy. Some suggestions we encourage you to try are to exercise, read, journal your feelings, listen to music, and watch TV or a movie. Using healthy coping skills will help with your depression, keep you busy, and distract your thoughts from whatever you are going through. Sometimes with feel it is others (family and friends) that make us happy, but this is not true. We are all responsible for our own happiness. 

We really think it would be beneficial if you were to call into a Hotline and speak with one of the crisis counselors. Please know that the counselors will speak with you about your feelings, listen to what you have to say, and will treat you with respect and courtesy. 

Chris, Counselor

Clearly, you need to seek a support group and have your concerns heard. it's true, cutting yourself may have been helping you relieve your depressions and anxieties but does it do you any good physically? You have to consider that your still alive and you have a choice. other people's lives are taken from them for no reason at all! You have a choice to face your problems while they can't as they are dead. try to read news worldwide and you might as well realize that you are not the only one who's having a problem. There's always a solution and finding one is your quest as life has given us all challenges, and that is yours to fulfill. If you're tired of living and if it's possible to donate your breath, why not consider give to a child born with leukemia or some major medical conditions, as they are not given any chance of experiencing to live and be tired of living! seriously!!

I am not in your shoes so never will I judge you and there is help. Your problem stress and depression resulting in self harm has been addessed  on jw.org. Check this site out and you should  be glad that you did.

If you are a teen, remember that the teen years are the absolute worst time of life.  I am surprised any of us survive it.  You are struggling with so much stress, pressures, changes... Your body and mind are trying to cope but ... its hard, dealing with unpredictable hormones and roller coaster emotions.
				
The brain is a very complicated and delicate thing.  It can get messed up and be unable to produce sufficient serotonin.  This is called a chemical imbalance which is easily treated, very common and nothing to be ashamed of.  

It can cause depression, anxiety, panic, obsession, self harm/self hatred, suicidal thoughts, eating disorders, sleeping problems, aggression/rage, anger, phobias, fears, helplessness, hopelessness, hypochondria, ADHD, paranoia, OCD, headaches, lack of interest in things, lack of motivation/ focus and much more.

According to those who have gone to therapists, counseling and therapy dont help much.  They are not even allowed to prescribe appropriate meds to help you get better. 

You dont need therapy but you DO need a dr.  He/she is the only one who can help.  Tell dr. about your symptoms and ask for anti-depressants.  Zoloft/Sertraline is a good one; most people thrive on it and it has no side effects.  It enables the brain to function properly.  

With the right antidepressants, you will be much better, happier, calmer, confident, relaxed, normal and self mutilation will no longer have a strangle-hold on you.  What a difference it makes!!   You need them, so stay ON them.  Youve tried everything else, so why not give meds a try.

Then, find a big happy church, attend some groups there and have fun.  Talk with the pastor/minister or the youth pastor/leader.  They have more wisdom than you and I.  And where else can you get FREE counseling?  

Troubled people need peace; a good pastor can show you how to have perfect peace.  God loves you more than you can possibly imagine :)

Bailey,

This is hard to deal with especially when you have become addicted to the pain that you inflict on yourself.  if you are not getting help from a counselor you should maybe try that.  Finding someone to help you step by step will help. Have you share this with any of your family?  You don't have to be alone.  it sounds like your friend is worried about you.  Hold onto that friendship. They can be there for you as well.  

You should come up with a safety plan for yourself, one you can follow when ever these thoughts of cutting come up.  Maybe have a list of people you can call (you can even use a crisis hotline as well.)  You can also have on that plan an idea of what else you can try.  Some people find that removing themselves from the items they use to cut work so going for a walk helps.  You can also try using a rubber band or piece of ice on your skin in the places you want to cut.  Sometimes the pain will help with the urge.  

Try to remember that you can help yourself by believing in yourself and knowing that you can get better.  It is not going to be an easy road.  You may even want to get involved with an outpatient program for more support.  You can do it though.  Just remember that.

CO Boys Town National Hotline

What you should be looking at is why you cut yourself to self-harm. Most people that harm themselves is because of the emotional pain they feel. There is no pill, ointment or bandaid that can take away an emotional pain and if the person is not skilled enough with how to cope with strong negative emotions they turn to a pain that is more familiar to them and is easily treatable and it also helps them focus on the physical pain that is more real because the body is injured, 

What seems to be the case with you is that you are looking for help, but the help you really need is from a professional who has experience and understanding of those who self-harm. Normally when someone suggests therapy it drums up an image of lying on a couch and a Froidian looking person asking his patient to tell them about their childhood and their parents and any emotional trauma they have experienced while very young. That is no longer the case for therapy, and the therapy that is usually reccomended is counselling rather than seeing a psychologist.

What has happened to you is you have had an experience that you have not been able to cope with and you have behaved in the only way you know by self-harming. The physical pain supresses the emotional pain but that emotional pain resurfaces all the time because the physical pain only covers the emotional pain, it doesn't heal the emotional pain.

You are looking for help because you are finding that your coping mechanism is becoming a problem along with your emotional paint.The help you need requires long term commitment which can be agreed upon between you and a cousellor. 

So you don't worry about what happens during a couselling ssession I will let you know what happens in a couselling session.

When the client meets the counsellor they draw up a mutaul contract. The cousellor will tell you all that you tell them is confidential but the only thing that cannot be kept confidential is if you intend to commit a criminal act that would seriously harm yourself or somebody else (self-harming is not considered a criminal act unless you are determined to take your own life). The counsellor will also set a time for how long the session will last for that first session.

Once that has been agreed upon the counsellor will let you talk about anything you want to talk about. If you find you can't think of anything to talk about the cousellor might ask how your day was. It becomes a conversation but the client does most of the talking. The counsellor will understand that you might not have revealed the core root of what has caused you to self-harm, it may be that you need time to trust the counsellor to determine if they are genuine or not, if what you tell them is going to be held in the strictest of confidentiality or if they are going to report you to your parents at the first opportunity. Counsellors cannot reveal anything the client said in a counselling session without the clients permission.

When you feel comfortable about talking about your self harm the counsellor will support you to find the solutions to your problems.

try and ease your way out of it, because quitting suddenly is really hard. i used to self harm 3 times a day, so i worked it down, 2 times a day, 1 time a day, every other day, few times a week, once a week, every few weeks, once a month… so on. it actually works. its a slow process but there isn't many other choices. and limit how much you do. like less than 10 cuts per time. something like that. also try and keep yourself distracted, that is key. exercise, funny movies, blogging, anything. busy busy busy, less busy you are, more time to think, more time to think, more negative thoughts, more negative thoughts, more self harm. its a cycle. Hang in there sweetie stay strong. btw, that girl DeAnne, copied and pasted things word for word that she answered my question with. just replaced a few things here and there. just calling her out on it.

Most people don't eat enough fiber.

Garcinia cambogia is the latest in a long line of "magic weight loss" supplements. 
 Right behind acai, green tea capsules, maquiberry, hoodia, moyoberry, green coffee gojiberry, fruta planta, hoodia, ma huang, raspberry ketones, and african mango seed extract. 
See a pattern here? Magic exotic plants or extracts. 
I wish Dr. Oz would quit "investigating" these unapproved weight loss supplements that send sales through the roof. 
Supplements are not regulated since they do not contain any controlled compound. Consumer Reports tested several a few years back and 70% of them did not contain listed amounts or ingredients.
You are not benefitting in any way so I would stop.
I have been taking it since August, I have lost 30 lbs and haven't found anything wrong with it. I have been getting my bottles off of this site www.slim-organics.com

They also warn that studies showing its effectiveness have all been short-term (12 weeks) and fairly small. However, the studies do show some promise, including one by Georgetown University.

I am very sorry to hear that your family hates you, that is just unfair.
But believe me, the situations in my very own life were no good a year ago.
I had nothing to showcase as my achievements, I repeatedly kept disappointing everyone, and I felt like I was no good at anything at all.
But the solution to my problems did not lie in ending my life.
That would only prove them right, the people who said I was no good. 
So instead, I turned my thought processes to "What can I do about this?"
And I searched, and I searched, and I found that if I tried hard enough, I could be better. At everything.
And that is exactly what I did.
And the end result was so much more than what I could ever, ever imagine.
So I suggest you to think about what I am saying.
There is always a way, and you are not alone. (Not giving you any philosophical ****, just the truth)
Find something that you're good at. There has to be something, for everyone. Pursue that.
Make your stand in the world, hold your head high and give yourself a reason to be proud of yourself.
And never listen to what society says to you. Okay, I know I am a part of it, but never listen to the mean words, the insults, the jibes, the fun making, anything negative. Give them a blind eye and a deaf ear.
And believe in yourself.
When you can finally respect yourself, you'll find others respecting you.
So make the change today, and never, ever again think of taking the easy way out.
You will not regret it, believe you, me.

Most sleeping problems are probably caused by stress, depression, anxiety and worry. 

Sleeping pills can give you bad side effects such as headaches and drowsiness during the day so you are better off without them. 

To sleep better just relax and switch off, if you can. 

If you are having trouble switching off at bedtime some light exercise (for example, push ups or sit ups) at bedtime often helps you to relax, unwind and switch off and that often improves your sleep. Strenuous exercise at bedtime is likely to ruin your sleep. 

Common OTC sleep aids include Chamomile tea, 5-HTP, Melatonin and Valerian Root. 

Sleep enhancing foods include warm milk, turkey, cherries, oatmeal, bananas, wine and others as in a web search for "sleep enhancing foods". 

You can see further tips in a web search for "how to fall asleep and stay asleep".

There's a few things you can do (I just lost my mother in Nov. 2013 & have been struggling with bipolar disorder + depression for over 10 years, so TRUST ME when I say that these things have worked for me, so they can def. work for you too) : 
1. Meditate (it sounds corny but it actually does work)
2. Seek counseling. Most states offer free counseling programs, that include giving free anxiety meds and/or talking to qualified awesome professionals. 
3. Always keep an open circle of trusted friends/family you can talk to. Sometimes being able to vent to unbiased people is the best therapy!!
4. If your sleep is completely off, take a sleep aid (Tylenol PM for example). Of course you can't take them forever, but they def. offer a quick run start
5. Do some yoga or exercise. People don't realize how doing the small things can greatly affect the mind in a positive way. 
6. Get to the root of your depression. When did it start? What/who are your triggers? Do the emotional homework & get to the deep rooted problem of your depression/anxiety. The depression itself is the "symptom" of the problem, NOT the root cause of the problem. You'd be surprised at how freeing it is when you can at least acknowledge the true source of the problem (the 1st step in getting help) 
7. Go back to doing all the things you stopped doing. Depression fatigues people, makes them go into the shadows & makes them lose interest in things/people they normally would've still been doing. Keep yourself distracted & FORCE yourself to go out & have fun. Don't isolate yourself no matter how much you want to b/c it'll just lead to a false sense of feeling like you're alone. If you used to write, go to karaoke, or go to really fun places or hang out with really fun friends before all the anxiety started, go back & do those things 
8. Go to a support group or do some research on depression. The best feeling in the world is when you realize that not only are you not alone, but there are people out there who face the same demons as you, if not worse! Just having someone you can relate to, especially if they've overcome the same demons you're trying to overcome, is probably the most effective methods to abolish depression (i.e. the advice I'm giving you)
9. If you're a spiritual or religious person, pray. Ask God to remove the depression, loneliness & anxiety from your spirit & body. 
10. Funny vines & videos are taking over the social media scene. Watching all the funny vines, videos & seeing all the hilarious memes has really helped me in grieving the death of my mother & my bipolar disorder
11. And keep doing what you're doing! It's great that you're asking for help & for solutions b/c that means that you're more strong & courageous than you think! We've all got demons of all kinds! It's just that some people (you) are more honest about it than others, so kudos! 
Goodluck

You need to inform yourself of your mother's situation and, apparently, some basic medical concepts.  Your mother needs to count on you now, and these wild ideas floating around in your head aren't going to help her one bit.
Your mother would do well to stay away from your children in case she catches anything from them that would interfere with her treatment.

Just because a person is unvaccinated, doesn't mean they're carriers of a disease. What's actually more dangerous is being around children who have been newly vaccinated with live virus vaccines, which include the MMR and certain flu vaccines. The children can shed the virus and infect an individual with a compromised immune system.

EDIT: I'm assuming I got 5 "thumbs down" because I didn't immediately attack this woman because she didn't vaccinate her children. While I am a stern proponent of vaccination, I thought it better to answer her question than attack her. I've been a chemotherapy nurse for 10 years. Part of the patient teaching when they begin chemotherapy is to avoid contact with children who have just received live-virus vaccines. And yes, April, these are definitely still used. MMR, varicella, rotovirus, and the nasal flu vaccine are all live-attenuated viruses. Once an individual is vaccinated, there is a small risk of infection to individuals with immune compromise.

Also, there is NO risk of contacting things like measles, mumps, or whooping cough from someone who DOESN'T have it. While unvaccinated children are at risk of contracting these diseases, they are not automatically carriers just because they haven't had their shots - which is what it sounds like some of you are saying. 

Patients undergoing chemotherapy should do their best to avoid situations in which they put themselves at risk. Your home is not one of them. Good hygiene, including hand washing, is a major step in prevention of communicable diseases.

Its immune-boosting properties seem to come from a heavy concentration of sulphur-containing compounds, such as allicin. Ginger acts like Vitamin C, and is good for preventing a cold or helping a cold. It packs some heat in the form of gingerol, a relative of capsaicin, which gives chili peppers their distinctive heat. Ginger may also help decrease chronic pain and may possess cholesterol-lowering properties. Spinach is rich in Vitamin C and is packed with numerous antioxidants and beta-carotene. Yogurt is a good source of Vitamin D, studies show someone who is low in Vitamin D is more likely to catch a cold. When selecting yogurt look for ones that have "live and active cultures" printed on the label. Almonds (Nuts) are a good source of Vitamin E, which also helps keep a healthy immune system, Vitamin E is a fat-soluble vitamin, meaning it requires the presence of fat to be absorbed properly. Turmeric a bitter spice has been used for years as an anti-inflammatory in treating both osteoarthritis and rheumatoid arthritis. High concentrations of curcumin, which gives turmeric its distinct color, have been shown to contain strong flu and cold fighting properties. Both green and black teas are packed with flavonoids, a type of antioxidant. Where green tea really shines is in its levels of epigallocatechin gallate, or EGCG, another powerful antioxidant. The fermentation process black tea goes through destroys a lot of the EGCG. Green tea, on the other hand, is steamed and not fermented, preserving that EGCG. If that wasn't enough, it's also a good source of the amino acid L-theanine, which aids in the production of germ-fighting compounds in your T-cells.

Sit back... this is a LONG answer, but I wanted to help you out! I know it can be frustrating. This REALLY works!! There are 3 people sent me an email saying to me that it worked for them!! Gather all materials beforehand -- see "Things You'll Need" below. You might want to store them in a waterproof resealable bag, such as Ziploc. I'd recommend wearing either old clothes or a bathrobe over whatever you are wearing. There is a definite possibility this is going to spill. After you have found everything on you checklist, head to a large, flat, waterproof surface. This is probably your bathroom. Having this room be private is highly advised; you can't just say, "Get out, I'm flattening a pimple," can you?

Things You'll Need 
- 3 or more cotton balls 
- Lukewarm tap water 
- Cup to hold the water in 
- Salt

The Method 
1. Salt the water thoroughly -- much more than you think it needs. 
2. Dip one cotton ball in the salt water. 
3. Wait for 30 - 60 seconds. 
4. Squeeze out excess water out until it is damp, but not dripping. 
5. Place the damp cotton ball over your large, oh-my-goodness-I-cannot-go-to-... zit. If you have several of these grouped together, try to place the cotton ball over them all. 
6. Glance at your watch/clock. Wait exactly three minutes. 
7. Remove the cotton ball after the time is up. The zit seems to be nearly gone, but it is only the top that has dissolved. Your acne is still there. 
8. Take the other two cotton balls and place them on either side of the despised pimple. 
9. Slowly, move them closer together until the tiny bump is flattened. Congrats! You've just conquered that giant of a pimple -- forever! 
10. Apply honey on the infected area & go to sleep!!

Tips 
*Don't forget the last 3 steps -- they are crucial. 
*Be sure to follow these steps closely. Dipping a cottonball in fresh water as opposed to salt will not work, for instants. 
* You might want to bring a book -- either waterproof or one that you do not care about being splattered in water. Those three minutes can get boring. 
* This is your best bet for monster zits that simply sneak up on you. For long-term healthy skin, cleansing and toning is also important.

Warnings 
* Please, PLEASE, do not assume this is permission to "pop" pimples. Doing so can cause major scarring. Please don't pop them. 
* If you stop after the top is dissolved, I must warn you: it WILL come back! Maybe not in the next five minutes, but during the course of an hour, it will come back!

You will be taken to a psychiatric ward at the hospital, where you will wait for a psychiatrist to evaluate you. However...

There are times in life when we might feel totally, hopeless, helpless, overwhelmed with emotional pain.  It can seem like there is no other way out of our problems, we've run out of ideas, possible solutions.  Our problems seem unfixable.  The pain feels like it will never end. We believe we've run out of options, and suicide is the only answer left.

Maybe the suicidal thoughts come to mind, you might have mixed feelings about them.  They're frightening and confusing. 

For some people, suicide may be a way of getting back at others, or showing them how much pain you're in.  But after suicide, you won't be there to see that they feel guilty, or finally understand your pain.

Suicide is a permanent solution to a temporary problem.

Feelings will pass.  Depression feels permanent, but it's transient.  Things will change.  Depression comes and it goes.  Over 90% of people who survive a potentially lethal suicide attempt, do not go on to kill themselves.  It is a temporary crisis, an attempt to stop the inner pain.    You will get through this tunnel and come out the other side.  The feelings will pass!

Depression and pain distort our thinking.  It can seem like we're wearing very dark tinted 'gloomy specs'.  Everything looks different to how it really is.  Thoughts are thoughts - not necessarily how things are, although it certainly feels like the thoughts are true.  Thoughts affect the way we feel, and thoughts and feelings affect the way we react, what we do.

Suicidal thoughts can result when we experience too much pain, without having enough resources to cope.

We therefore have two ways to get us through this horrible time:

    Reduce our pain

    Increase our coping resources

REDUCE THE PAIN

Self-soothing

    Do something that will help you feel better, right now

    Perhaps collect items into an emergency bag or box that you can turn to

    Use all five senses to find things that will soothe you

Vision 	

Focus your attention on looking at something nice, nature, a painting, watching a favourite programme or movie
Hearing 	

Listen to a favourite piece of music, sounds of nature, sing
Smell 	

Really notice smells - favourite soap, food, essential oil
Taste 	

Use sensation of taste to focus your attention.  Eat mindfully - savouring each moment
Touch 	

Wear soft comforting socks, stroke a pet, give yourself a hand massage

    A useful reminder, using the 5 senses:

5
	

   5 things I can see

4
	

   4 things I can hear

3
	

   3 things I can touch

2
	

   2 things I can smell or taste

1
	

   1 breath.  Then continue to just notice your breathing, and the sensations of breathing in your body - in your nose, throat, abdomen

Avoid drugs and alcohol

    Whilst it seems like they help for a while, they will make your problems worse.

Ask yourself:

    Are these thoughts facts or my opinion?

    What has helped me feel better in the past?

    What can I do right now that will help me feel better?

    What gives my life meaning?  What are my goals, dreams or life values?  E.g. Family, friends, pets, helping others, faith, spirituality, community life, connecting with nature.

Tell yourself:

    I've coped this far, I can get through the next .... (day, hour, 10 minutes)

    Things will look better in time.

    Depression is temporary - this will pass.

    Suicide is a permanent solution to a temporary problem.

    Depression is distorting my thinking - these thoughts are the voice of depression.  They are not facts.  I don't have to act on them.

    The vast majority of people get better from depression.  I will look back and be pleased that I chose to live.

 

INCREASE COPING RESOURCES - IMMEDIATE STEPS

Take one step at a time

    Take things a little at a time.  Set out to get through the next day, the next week or month, perhaps the next hour or even less.  Tell yourself:  "I've got through so far, I can get through the next hour".

Distraction

    Do something else, and focus your attention fully on what you're doing, e.g.

    Gardening

    Household chores

    Physical exercise - walk, run, cycle, dance

    Tapping (Emotional Freedom Technique)

    Reading - magazine, self help book

    Television

    Seek out a supportive discussion forum on the internet

    Learn something new on the internet

    Imagery

    Help someone else

    Go to the park, the beach - pay attention to nature

    Visit someone

    Music

    Stroke a pet

    DIY

    Feed the birds

    Sudoku or crossword

    Do something creative:  painting, writing, knitting, play a musical instrument, make a collage, bake a cake, cook a meal, arrange some flowers, make a website or blog

Talk to someone - now!

    A friend or family member

    A telephone helpline  (E.g. Samaritans 08457 90 90 90)

    A health professional

    Go somewhere you'll feel safe - be with other people

    Go to the local Accident & Emergency department

    Call the local emergency number (E.g. 999, 112, 911)

 

INCREASE COPING RESOURCES - LONGER TERM STEPS

Take action!

    We can only change our situations by changing something about the way we think, or what we do


Plan activity and routine

    Increase your activity

    Get into a daily routine and stick with it - get up at the same time each day, go to bed at the same time, plan an activity each morning, afternoon and evening

    Schedule in activities which help you:  Work, rest and play

    Do things you enjoy, or used to enjoy, or you think you might enjoy:  Nourishing vs Depleting Activities

    Set realistic goals

Look after yourself

    Eat healthily, balance sleep, treat physical or mental health problems, avoid drugs and alcohol, get regular exercise

Systematically work through a problem

    Use the Problem Solving Worksheet

    Get help from an appropriate person or agency  (E.g. Citizens Advice Bureau)

Maintain or improve relationships

    Connect and be with others

    Call, text, email - friends or family

    Create new contacts - join a local support group or an online discussion forum

Lower your expectations

    Sometimes life can feel like we're struggling to drive or cycle up a long and steep hill, in top gear.  The motor just can't get us there.  It works really hard, but it's impossible to get up that steep hill in top gear.  We need to change down a gear or two.  Changing down gives the motor more torque, and is much better able to drive those wheels up that hill, albeit a bit slower.

    We often try to struggle on in top gear, expecting so much of ourselves, of others, of life itself.  Sometimes we need to change down a gear.  Slow it down, reduce the struggle.  Carry on, but in a lower gear.

Fast Facts Of Paracetamol Overdose:

The lethal action takes 2-3 days to start and during these 2 to 3 days you will have slight vomiting and suffer from nausea and a slight pain on the right side of the tummy! Unlike other drugs, you don't go into coma after an overdose of paracetamol. This is very annoying because next morning you will wake up normally and wonder what happened to you!
After 2-3 days, liver starts getting damaged (Hepatic damage) and so does your kidneys (Renal damage).
Slight signs of jaundice appears (bilirubin starts increasing. The normal bilirubin level is 1 and when it increases beyond 1, it means jaundice is making a hole in you!) and you will face terrible pain in stomach.

hey, i'm YY to. i've been through the same thing, i think most people our age at some point do for a while. i'm not going to tell you you're stupid because you're not and i'm not going to beg you not to do it because i know you're way smarter than that. i used to hate the phrase 'suicide is a permanent solution to a temporary problem', i thought no one understood me and i was the only one going through those weird thoughts.

but let's just point out what would happen if you overdosed. first of all, i don't think you realise how many people would be affected. in drama class we are doing a script that i thought was stupid first but now i totally get it - a guy kills himself because he believes no one cares. obviously, his family hate themselves and his friends wish theyd been better to him. but other people get affected also, those strangers he sees in the halls suddenly wish they'd said something and teachers wish they hadnt been so harsh and everyone suddenly wishes they'd prevented it, because they all cared about him. then word gets around to his family friends and everyone who knew him felt a huge hole because they just knew it was preventable. and it is, if you ever want to talk to someone im always here, you can email me any time. you can talk to trained professionals, doctors, your parents, your friends, your teachers, just anyone you feel somfortable with. depression and suicidal thoughts can be prevented, it takes time but it can.

so then, what happens if you overdose and end up in hospital? a kid in the year above me actually did this, and he had to change schools. the head teacher didnt want any copycats, and most schools actually tend to remove the child from their school. its sad but its true. then there are the actual health issues, you could be left with permanent damage with your stomach, liver, digestive system and more (please correct me if i'm wrong, i was told this by a teacher), and you could live the rest of your life with serious health conditions, which would obviously suck ass.

i know its difficult but its best to get rid of these thoughts, its definitely easier said than done, but it is possible. i was so depressed for such a long time and then i suddenly saw all the good things in a cruel world, and after a year or 2 and some help from my friends, i feel so much better about myself. i know you said you were being abused and bullied, so maybe you might not want to tell family and friends but there is ALWAYS someone. you can contact childline, ive used it before and its actually very helpful. you can talk to teachers like i said, its embarrassing at first but they will sort it out, trust me. things like depression and suicide shouldnt be romanticized and inspirational, you are your own hero and you need to find help.

so to answer your question, if you overdose and end up in hospital you could possibly suffer from permanent health damage, get asked to leave your school and maybe even end up even more upset than you are now. the best option is to find help, i promise :) and sorry for the very long answer
you only live once and your so young why do you want to kill yourself. Believe me I did not have it easy when I was YY either , focus on your studies and go for gold. But please dont kill yourself

Your YY...you cant take your life away! Honestly, I've thought about the same thing your going through,,, but look where I am now: I'm in love with my life. My life is nothing special, I'm not rich, I don't have many friends, I don't have many people to rely on, however when I think about what the future holds- I can't wait to grow up...I can't wait to see what a stronger, better person I'll become- you should feel the same way too....

If you can't realise this on your own, there are so many organisations that you can call, because there are so many more people going through the same thing you are. YY years of your life isn't half, a quarter, a fifth, a sixth, a seventh or even an eighth of your age...is giving up on life worth it?

Just remember if you commit suicide your not only ending your life, but your families, your friends and mine too.

Push it in until you fingers touch your skin. Then push on the little pushy thing until the tampon is out of the inserting thing. It is impossible to lose your tampon in your vagina. I definitely prefer tampons to pads in all situations. They are cleaner, easier, more effective, more efficient, and much more comfortable than pads. If I had my way I would only use tampons but even if I get the ultra maxi super plus whatever I need a pad also because it's so heavy.

Neither, I prefer menstrual cups. 

Menstrual cups are internal like tampons but FAR safer and more hygienic so no risks of TSS, vaginal infections, increased cramps, or dioxin - thus they can be worn for up to 12 hours, with any flow, before your period, overnight, and no need to alternate with pads so a lot more convenient than tampons. Menstrual cups are more comfortable, can reduce flow and cramps, also don't leak like tampons or pads.

I seriously recommend you consider cups instead of tampons, they're far better in general but also when active they're better than tampons as you can't wear tampons when your flow is light, tampons can increase cramps, and tampons leak. Any cup user will tell you, tampons suck by comparison. 

If you do still want to use tampons...

Avoid rayon tampons like Tampax, Playtex, or Kotex - these are made from rayon which is rougher than cotton so causes more damage to vaginal tissues, also is more favourable to bacteria and contains chemicals - these increase risk of TSS, vaginal infections, increased cramps, contain dioxin, and more likely to cause irritation too. Opt for cotton tampons like Cottons, Natracare, or Emerita, you may also be more comfortable with sponge tampons like J&P or soft tampons like Beppy as they're soft and squishy plus are moistened before use with either water or lubrication so not as drying or irritating. 

Non-applicator are best - applicators sole purpose is to limit genital contact, not to make insertion easier, and as there's nothing wrong with genital contact there's no reason to use applicators. Non-applicator are easier because they're simpler, have rounder tips, you have more control over depth so you can insert high enough first time, and you have more control over direction as you can more easily feel for resistance. 

Always start with lowest absorbency during heaviest flow; if the tampon leaks within 1-2 hours use higher, but if the tampon isn't saturated with blood after 4-6 hours use lower absorbency or switch back to pads. It helps to use lubrication the first time too, something like KY jelly or a natural oil like coconut oil or olive oil around the vaginal opening and on the tampon - do not ever use Vaseline or baby oil. 

Masturbation helps as when aroused your vagina relaxes, lubricates, opens, increase in size, and tents to allow penetration, thus it can help when inserting a little tampon - same goes for if you struggle with removal too. It also helps to explore your genitals, if you haven't already, to get used to inserting things vaginally and learn to purposefully tense/relax vaginal muscles so you can relax them during insertion.

As long as you use tampons correctly and relax (if you tense vaginal muscles tense, thus causing vaginal walls to clench) they shouldn't hurt, although they can be uncomfortable. As long as you relax they also won't get stuck either - what goes up must come down.

It's not embarrassing to still wear pads.  I'm well in my 20s and still use them most of the time.  

Tampons can offer you a lot of freedom during your period.  Personally, I like being able to keep track of my flow, and that's why I usually use a pad, but here are some tips:

Start out by trying the lowest absorbency tampon you can get.  Something like "lite" or even "regular" will work.  Definitely use plastic applicators - they are much easier to insert.  When you try them, do it on the heaviest day of your period.  Follow the instructions in the box.  When you insert it, remember to point up and toward your back, not straight up.  You shouldn't be able to feel it when it's inserted properly.

You should only wear the lowest absorbency that you need to control your flow for 4-6 hours.  They way to tell if you need to change is easy - when you go to the bathroom, gently pull on the string.  If it starts to slide out easily, it's time to change.  If it stays put, you can leave it in for a bit longer, but NEVER more than eight hours.  In fact, you might want to switch to a lower absorbency so that it's ready to be changed about every six hours or so, just to be safe and prevent TSS.

Don't flush applicators or used tampons.  The box might say you can, but believe me, it's not a good idea!  Wrap them in toilet paper and put them in the trash or the receptacle in the stall.

Finally, wear a liner or a pad along with tampons for the first few times you use them until you get used to it.  I always wear a liner just in case.

"The dark spots that remain on skin—called post-inflammatory pigmentary alteration—are caused by inflammation during the skin's healing process. When skin is opened up, like when you pop a pimple, and then closes back together, you can get abnormal pigmentation, texture, and tone that looks different from the rest of your skin. Sometimes broken blood vessels that remain after an acne lesion fades can result in a mark that appears more red or purple than brown. These are commonly seen in people who are more fair/light skinned." The dark spot takeaway? Hands off! Seriously, don't pick, poke, or touch a pimple. You'll regret it. And this is why. 
But sometimes a particular blemish just has it out for your face and there's no stopping its path to a scar. "Acne scars occur when normal tissue in the skin is destroyed and replaced with fibrous tissue. You can think of an acne lesion as a wound. When the damage caused by acne is severe, the body can respond by creating too much tissue or too little tissue. The production of too much tissue forms a keloid or a hypertrophic scar, and too little tissue leads to that depression in the skin, or atrophic scar. The deeper and more inflamed the acne lesion, or the more that it is picked or squeezed, the more likely it is to scar."

Sounds like you're really constipated. You've got several choices- if you think you can wait for it to work, take a stool softener or a laxative (stool softener is probably better, but laxatives work quicker, just don't make a habit of using them); or you can drink a big glass of water or fruit juice (like grape juice or prune juice, but make sure it's real juice, not juice drink or punch). These will probably help within a couple of hours.

You can also try doing some light exercises; something as simple as walking a few laps around your house may help. The movement seems to help make the muscles down there work better...don't know why, it just works. This also may not work immediately, it may take a while after you walk for it it to work.

Another option, if you really feel you need relief right away, is to give yourself an enema or have someone (like your mom) do it for you. I mention this because of how bad you say you feel- an enema will usually give you relief within a few minutes, but it needs to be done carefully...whoever does it should follow the directions on the package very carefully.

Finally, if nothing helps within a few hours and you are still in pain, go to the hospital. It's possible you may have a more serious problem, like an impaction. In this case, there's something in the intestines that's actually blocking them, keeping you from being able to go. This is pretty rare, but it can happen. Even if that's not the problem, they can help you more than you might be able to do at home.

Hope this helps.

answers.answer_text: You can achieve this either by cutting back on your food intake, by increasing physical activity, or ideally, by doing both.

21 days to lose weight, that is, within 21 days, by controlling the amount and type of diet to control eating time, without relying on medication or exercise to achieve weight loss results.

21 days diet is divided into three stages, namely, three days before the fasting stage, the eight days of fruits and vegetables meal, 10 days after the 6 into a full diet. However, this weight loss methods have side effects, to some extent will affect health care must be adopted.

Three stages of 21 days to lose weight law

The first phase of 21 days diet: 3 days ago: Fresh off therapy (Note: complete fasting, only water, detoxification phase, you can use honey water).

The second phase of 21 days diet: in 8 days: food fruits and vegetables, not too much (note: fast food, fats and sweets category, Cellulite stage).

The third phase of 21 days diet: After 10 days: normal diet can (Note: appetite 6 into a full, five hours before going to bed not enter any food).

Count calories and reduce your daily diet to 1,000 calories...except do not count the calories in fruits and vegetables (but do count calories in things you put on them, like cheese or dressing).  An easy way to do this is to go on a diet of ready-made meals like Smart Ones or some other commerical variety.

Up your workout to seven days a week.  Try to do 40 minutes of cardio and 20 minutes of strength training.  (Do alternating strength training so that you're not working the same muscles on back-to-back days, but rather on alternating days.)  Work out hard enough to get breathing hard and sweaty, but not to the point where you're exhausted and dehydrated.  Standard advice before beginning any workout is consult with a doctor first to make sure you're healthy enough to be doing this.

Weigh yourself every morning after using the bathroom.  Record your daily weight.  This is for motivation.

Every two weeks or so, for ONE MEAL ONLY eat whatever you want.  Don't weigh yourself for the next two days after doing this.

Drink a LOT of water.

If you stick to this program faithfully, you could lose 5 pounds a week.  This is an unhealthy rate of weight loss to sustain, and if you continue it, you will notice repercussions.  Like for instance, you may start to shed a lot of hair.  After you've lost your 10 pounds, increase your diet to a more healthy 1,400 to 1,600 calories per day and set a weight loss goal of closer to 2 pounds a week, 3 at the most.

Good luck but also be careful.

Cardio is best for weight loss! So running, swimming, cycling etc. 

Make sure that the foods you eat are the right foods also. Lots of vegetables (especially green ones) some fruit, healthy fats, lean protein and wholegrains. Swap white bread/flour/pasta for wholemeal and white rice for brown. Also swap whole milk for skim/trim/soy. Limit fried, deep fried, creamy, fatty and sugary foods. Drink a lot of water and green tea (green tea is believed to help speed up your metabolism). If you're interested in trying to speed up your metabolism you could also try incorporating metabolism speeding foods into your diet such as cayenne pepper, cinnamon, yoghurt, oats, green tea etc (google for more).

Now load the weed into the wrench piece and place the wrench piece on the water bottle and maybe turn it a little so it stays securely on. Put your lips over the pen and suck in while lighting the weed. It's kind of an awkward position but when you start seeing smoke stop lighting and keep sucking in until the bottle fills with smoke. Take the cap off (be careful, the metal wrench piece will be hot), and inhale all the smoke in the bottle from the top. Repeat until the weed ashes and you don't get anymore smoke. Anxiety can cause a lot of health problems. 

Anxiety often comes and goes. 

Anxiety is a state of fear of real or imagined danger, which is manifested as increased heart rate, trembling, panic, weakness, extreme fatigue and stomach or intestinal discomfort. 

Anxiety, depression, nervousness, worry or stress can cause over 100 symptoms or health problems as in a web search for "over 100 anxiety symptoms". 

Prescription medication for anxiety, stress, nervousness, depression and worry can give you bad side effects so natural remedies are often much better. 

Natural remedies for anxiety, stress, nervousness, worry and depression include exercise, Yoga, Chamomile tea, Melatonin, 5-HTP, Valerian Root, other herbs, vitamin B complex and other remedies as in a web search for "natural anxiety remedies".

You can be put on safe anti-anxiety medications which can help with the symptoms, and/or you can enter talk therapy where you can learn techniques about ways to better manage the symptoms. 

I'm sure you;ve tried a lot, so I'm not going to go into ways you can try to relax (like yoga and mindfulness and whatnot). But this IS treatable. Don't give up, and try to stay healthy. Drinking may put a band-aid on it for a short while, but it wont fix it and it can cause greater problems in the long run.

One thing I do suggest is not doing too much too soon. Gradually work your way into the world again if you suffer from severe social anxiety. Don't try to jump in the deep end. Just walk around out side by yourself and observe people.. then go to the park and sit on a bench. imagine yourself interacting with people. then try to do so....so on and so forth. Once you can feel relaxed doing one thing, move onto something a little more challenging. it will eventually and gradually get better. Don't try to do it all in one day. Be patient with yourself. It didn't start occuring overnight and it won't go away overnight either. 

Visualization helps A LOT. If you can't even think about something without getting anxious, then there is no way you will actually be able to do it without suffering. But once you have thought about it enough and thought about ways to relax and cope, you will feel better, more in control, and better able to handle the situation when the time comes.

Protein is an essential nutrient for building muscle, because your muscles are primarily composed of protein. Healthy options include chicken, fish, and turkey. Vegetarian options include tofu, tempeh, and Satan.
Do 30 minutes of cardiovascular exercise per day. These exercises help burn calories, and when coupled with an improved diet, can help you shed pounds.

1. Lower/control your daily calorie intake (control for normal
weight, lower for overweight).
2. Run/jog to lower your overall body fat percentage.

an excellent exercise you can do it at home in front of your TV:
 Attach a couple of ankle weights to your ankles.
 Lay down on the floor or any other hard
 surface. Use an exercise rug so as not to bruise your spine off the
 floor. Put your hands behind your head, or spread them wide. Lift
 your legs perpendicular to the floor, stop for a second. Lower the
 legs down. Repeat ten times, stop. Turn on your stomach, raise on
 your hands, with the lower part of the body on the floor, as if
 trying to look at the ceiling. Turn back, do another set. Do three
 sets with ten repetitions every day. In a week, you should see the
 results. Once you are used to the exercise, and your muscles won't
 get stronger anymore, add weight to your ankle weights. Remember:
 repeating the same easy exercise many times won't help. Do it only
 with the weights. Simple leg raises do not work. Use weights,
 they do wonders. Stretch your spine between repetitions. Be careful
 not to go for too heavy weight at once. Do not increase the weights
 continuously, stop when your abs are defined - too heavy weights
 will lead to injuries.

I can tell you about two ways of dealing with emotional pain.  One is to use the methods commonly used to treat depression, and there's a number of good ones.  The other, which is not so well known but is gaining acceptance in psychology, is for us to change the way we experience the pain.  I'll give you a link for common depression treatments, because the other way needs some explanation.  

This link with for the kind of answer I often give for questions from people who are very badly depressed.  It has information from experts on a variety of treatments - self help and office visits.

http://answers.yahoo.com/question/index?qid=20140211085610AAuz0Gv

If you want more information, click on my name and Best Answers.

This is about experiencing pain, which can go along with the treatments I've just referre to.

'The two things to practice are acceptance and mindfulness.  

When I say "acceptance," I don't mean pretending that the pain is good. I mean being realistic - above all, not hoping that it will go away overnight or that we'll live happily ever after, like in a fairy tale. It also means not getting carried away about it - me not saying that a bad day was the worst day of my life, as if I had a day-evaluating machine and data collected from my whole life.  If you have a bad day, just say "I had a bad day" Period.

Mindfulness takes a bit of explaining but it's not hard to understand.  It means awareness - awareness of the here and now and awareness of what's happening in our bodies and minds.

Suppose you were wearing sunglasses day and night for two weeks, and the glasses were so dark that you could hardly see where you were.  One day, you took the glasses off.  Imagine how things would look - all that light, color and details - the grain of wood in a chair or sunlight reflected off points on a glass bottle.  

The room would seem real, more real than ever before.  It's a intense feeling of the here and now. When we're lost in our thoughts, it's like wearing sunglasses.  We don't really see what's around us.

Most of our troubles are in the past or the future.  If we're right there in the present moment, we feel better.  If we quiet our thoughts, we know the present moment.  Also, we notice as thoughts come and go, including the negative thoughts that hurt - memories and fears of the future that are useless and often false.

Look at your hands and slowly move them as if washing your hands.  Notice the feelings in your fingertips as your gently rub your fingers together.  Look at the palms of your hands.  Notice all the lines going across the palms.  Take two slow, deep breaths. Say, "Here and now."  You're in the present moment, where past and future don't bother you.  Look around and notice all the light and color in the room.  When thoughts come to you, notice them but don't get lost in them.  If a memory comes to you, don't go back to the past and relive the memory.  Let the thoughts come and go.  Notice the negative thoughts and let them go.  Don't fight with any thoughts - just let them go.

Books that explain this

The Mindful Way Through Depression (See MBCT.com)
Full Catastrophe Living by Dr Jon Kabat-Zinn

A 2-minute explanation by Dr Kabat-Zinn of the Univ. of Mass. Medical Center

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UkTC6jrtbfY

An interview with Dr Williams of Oxford about MBCT.

answers.answer_text: She could be suffering from iron deficiency. Has she seen the doctor?

There are many clinical considerations. I would suggest that she make any appointment with her PCP (primary care physician). Lab work may be required to rule out things like high cholesterol, diabetes & sleep-apnea, among other things. You can take note of things such as: Does she get sleepy after meals? Does she wake up multiple times at night? Is she excessively thirsty?

Dextrose tablets are really only to be used with someone with Hypoglycemia (low blood sugars) if she has a high A1c (from the blood work) the high blood sugars may be making her feel tired. 

Your right however about the exercise. The more active you are the more active you will be. Work and exercise are two different things. (My dad didnt think so, funny) But yes, exercise can help you feel more energy. 

Other considerations might be her BMI. If your mom is a little on the heavier side a stress test might be required to check for plaque in the arteries. I would suggest she see her PCP before anything else. I hope this was helpful.

she needs to see a doctor.  fatigue can be a symptom of a variety of diseases.  only blood work and a thorough exam can determine what her fatigue comes from.  everyone in here is simply guessing.  see a doctor and get a realistic diagnosis.

Fatigue often triggers off further problems such as headaches, migraines, dizziness, lightheadedness, shakiness and nausea. 

To combat fatigue perhaps the energy vitamin B12 can help or a vitamin B complex. Coenzyme Q10 can also help to boost your energy level as in a web search for "coenzyme q10 for energy". The super food Spirulina is another good energy booster. 

One of the most common fatigue causes is anxiety which is a state of fear of real or imagined danger, which is manifested as increased heart rate, trembling, panic, weakness, extreme fatigue and stomach or intestinal discomfort. 

Besides anxiety there are many other common fatigue causes such as insufficient sleep, too much sleep, under eating, thyroid problems or other illnesses (such as anemia, mononucleosis, CFS, glandular fever and many others), side effects from medication, dehydration, overexertion, an unhealthy diet and other causes as discussed in a web search for "common fatigue causes".
